name: topontopon
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))))

stmt.origin: sylib(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))), wcel(c0, ctop))
stmt.pretty: sylib(c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1), c0 ∈(TopOn ` ⋃ c0), c0 ∈ Top)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))))

-| wb(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)→ c0 ∈(TopOn ` ⋃ c0))
⊣ (c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)→ c0 ∈ Top)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Top ↔ c0 ∈(TopOn ` ⋃ c0))

comment: A topology on a set is a topology on the union of its open sets. (Contributed by BJ, 27-Apr-2021.)
